AL.format_explanation: The first part (AA) represents two serial letters, followed by three digits (000), and the last part (AA) represents two additional serial letters.
AL.alphabet: Latin; letters O, Q, V, X, Y are not used, Z is reserved for government vehicles, and W is not used in Albanian language.
AL.colors_strip: Blue strip with 'AL' and a white double-headed eagle
AL.strip_contents: Year of registration and regional code in white

AD.format_explanation: The plate consists of one letter followed by four digits.
AD.alphabet: Latin (notable restrictions include that the letter 'O' is not used to avoid confusion with the number '0').
AD.strip_contents: Coat of arms and country code AND

AM.format_explanation: The first part (00) represents numbers potentially indicating a regional code, followed by two letters (AA) that are smaller in size. The final part consists of another set of numbers (000). The reverse format (000 AA 00) is used for government vehicles.
AM.alphabet: Latin (A-Z), with specific letters gradually introduced over time. Initially, a few Armenian letters were also used.
AM.colors_strip: Silver identifier band on the right side of the flag and code
AM.strip_contents: National flag of Armenia and the international code 'AM'

AT.format_explanation: AA indicates the provincial code, ∇ represents the provincial emblem, 000 is a three-digit sequence, and AA are letters distinguishing the vehicle.
AT.alphabet: Latin; the letter Q is excluded from all sequences.
AT.forbidden_combinations: The letter Q is excluded from all sequences.
AT.vanity_plates: Yes, personalized plates are available for a fee of €228.30 for registration and €21.00 for the plates themselves.
AT.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
AT.strip_contents: EU flag and country code A

BY.format_explanation: Four digits representing the vehicle identifier, followed by two letters for the plate series and a final digit indicating the registration region.
BY.alphabet: Cyrillic and Latin alphabets; restricted to the letters A, E, I, O, B, C, H, K, P, T, X.

BE.format_explanation: 1 digit followed by 3 letters and 3 digits. The digit does not provide geographical information.
BE.alphabet: Latin alphabet with the use of characters except M, O, Q, and W in certain positions originally, but these restrictions were lifted. Acronyms of political parties are not permitted.
BE.forbidden_combinations: Combinations starting with M, O, Q, U, W, Z are restricted due to standard regulations. Additionally, combinations imitating special uses (e.g., CD-1234, A-0 to A-99999) are not allowed.
BE.vanity_plates: Personalized plates are available starting with 9 and can include combinations of five or six characters. Since March 31, 2014, full customization is allowed except for imitating reserved combinations.
BE.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
BE.strip_contents: EU flag and country code B

BA.format_explanation: A is a letter, 00 is a two-digit number, A is a single letter, and 000 is a three-digit number. The format does not indicate geographic origin.
BA.alphabet: Latin and Cyrillic script letters: A, E, O, J, K, M, T.

BG.format_explanation: AA is the province code (1 or 2 letters), 0000 is a four-digit serial number, and AA is a two-letter series code.
BG.alphabet: Cyrillic and Latin alphabets; only letters common to both are used.
BG.forbidden_combinations: The letters Е, О, and У are not used in the series; E is reserved for trailers, and U and O are not used as they are vowels.
BG.vanity_plates: Personalized plates are available but cost BGN 7,000 (approx. €3,500).
BG.colors_strip: Blue EU band with the country code BG
BG.strip_contents: EU flag and country code BG

CH.format_explanation: AA represents a two-letter code for the canton, followed by 000000, which represents a serial number with up to 6 digits.
CH.alphabet: Latin alphabet; letters I, O, Q, and certain combinations that can cause offense or are deemed inappropriate are not used.
CH.vanity_plates: Personalized plates are available, but specific rules and costs are not mentioned.

CY.format_explanation: The first part consists of three letters which may represent a specific area, and the second part consists of three digits that run incrementally from 001 to 999.
CY.alphabet: Latin alphabet, with the letters ABEHKMNPTXYZ used.
CY.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
CY.strip_contents: EU flag and country code CY

CZ.format_explanation: The first digit and following two letters indicate the region code, followed by a four-digit serial number.
CZ.alphabet: Latin; the letters G, CH, O, Q, and W may not be used
CZ.forbidden_combinations: The letters G, CH, O, Q, and W may not be used to avoid confusion, and the license plate cannot contain any abusive or offensive words.
CZ.vanity_plates: Custom ('personalized') plates are available for a fee of 5,000 CZK per plate, requiring at least one number and formatted as XXX-XXXXX.
CZ.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
CZ.strip_contents: EU flag and country code CZ

DE.format_explanation: An area code of one to three letters followed by an identifier sequence consisting of one or two letters and one to four digits.
DE.alphabet: Latin; certain diacritical marks (Ä, Ö, Ü) are included, but the letter ß is not allowed.
DE.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
DE.strip_contents: EU flag and country code D

DK.format_explanation: Two letters followed by a space, and then five digits.
DK.alphabet: Latin alphabet; Danish letters Æ, Ø, and Å are used in vanity plates.
DK.vanity_plates: Yes, personalized plates are available at a cost of kr.9,180 (approximately €1,227) per set, renewable every eight years for kr.8,000 (€1,073).
DK.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
DK.strip_contents: EU flag and country code DK

EE.format_explanation: Three numbers followed by three letters; the numbers denote the vehicle's registration number, while the letters are a part of the serial identification.
EE.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
EE.strip_contents: EU flag and country code EST

ES.format_explanation: 0000 represents the numeric sequence from 0000 to 9999, and AAA is a three-letter series that increments after the numeric sequence reaches 9999.
ES.alphabet: Latin; certain consonants like B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N, P, R, S, T, V, W, X, Y, and Z are used for the letters.
ES.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
ES.strip_contents: EU flag and country code E

FI.format_explanation: Three letters followed by a dash and three numbers.
FI.alphabet: Latin, with the letters A-Z used. No special restrictions mentioned.
FI.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
FI.strip_contents: EU flag and country code FIN

FR.format_explanation: The registration plate consists of two letters, followed by three numbers, and ending with two letters. The first two letters are random, the numbers are sequential, and the last two letters are also random.
FR.alphabet: Latin, with the letters I, O, U being excluded to avoid confusion with numbers (1 and 0) and the letter V respectively.
FR.forbidden_combinations: I, O, and U are not used; SS is forbidden due to associations with the Nazi organization. Other combinations like KK, PD, PQ, QQ, and WC may have been avoided in previous systems but are included now. WW is reserved for temporary registration plates.
FR.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
FR.strip_contents: EU flag and country code F, along with the department code and regional logo on the right

GB.format_explanation: The first two letters indicate the area code where the vehicle was registered, followed by a two-digit age identifier and a three-letter sequence that uniquely distinguishes the vehicle.
GB.alphabet: Latin; letters I, Q, and Z are not used as area codes, and I is also excluded from the three-letter sequence due to similarities with numbers.
GB.forbidden_combinations: I, Q, Z; combinations that may appear offensive are restricted, including in foreign languages.
GB.vanity_plates: Personalized/vanity plates are available, excluding letters I, Q, Z but including J, T, and U; costs vary.
GB.colors_background: White at the front, yellow at the rear
GB.typeface: Mandatory (typeface), a variation of Charles Wright

GE.format_explanation: The first two letters represent the region or type of vehicle, the three numbers are the serial number, and the last two letters often indicate the type of vehicle or provide further identification.
GE.colors_strip: Blue vertical strip with the Georgian flag and 'GE'

GR.format_explanation: The first three letters represent the prefecture code where the car was registered, and the four numbers are a serial number ranging from 1000 to 9999.
GR.alphabet: Latin alphabet, with only those letters whose capital letter matches a letter from the Greek alphabet.
GR.colors_strip: Blue strip with the EU flag and country code GR
GR.strip_contents: EU flag and country code GR

HR.format_explanation: The first two letters represent the city code, followed by three or four numbers and one or two letters (e.g. ZG 000-A, ZG 000-AA).
HR.alphabet: Latin; letters Q, W, X, and Y are not used as they are not part of the Croatian alphabet.
HR.vanity_plates: Yes, personalized plates are available. They can consist of a word with 4 to 7 letters or a combination of a word with 4 or 5 letters and 1 or 2 numbers, but they can only be used for five years after registration and require a fee of 2,000 kuna (approx. 270 euros).
HR.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
HR.strip_contents: EU flag and country code HR

HU.format_explanation: AA is a two-letter prefix, ∇ represents the Hungarian coat of arms, AA is a two-letter series, and 000 is a three-digit serial number.
HU.alphabet: Latin; the letters I, O, and Q are restricted in certain positions.
HU.forbidden_combinations: I and O cannot be the last letter; Q cannot be used at all; these restrictions prevent confusion with numbers.
HU.vanity_plates: Personalized plates are available in formats of three letters and three numbers (~€350) or four letters and two numbers or five letters and one number (~€1300); offensive or misleading texts are not allowed.
HU.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
HU.strip_contents: EU flag and country code H

IE.format_explanation: 000 represents the year or half-year of registration (first two digits are the year, third digit indicates the half of the year), AA is the area code, and 000000 is a sequence number for the vehicle.
IE.alphabet: Latin, with letters A to Z used, excluding O, I, and Q to avoid confusion with numbers 0 and 1.
IE.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars

IS.format_explanation: Three letters followed by two digits, with letters representing a random combination and digits a numeric sequence.
IS.alphabet: Latin; the letters 'Q', 'W', and 'Z' are not used.
IS.vanity_plates: Available, must not follow the standard format and can have 2-6 characters.
IS.colors_strip: Integrated into plate design (no separate strip)
IS.strip_contents: Icelandic flag and country code IS

IT.format_explanation: The plate consists of two letters, followed by three numbers, followed by two letters.
IT.alphabet: Latin alphabet, excluding the letters I, O, Q, and U.
IT.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars and country code I on the left; additional blue band on the right for registration year and provincial code
IT.strip_contents: EU flag and country code I; optional year of registration and provincial code on the right

LI.format_explanation: FL represents the country code for Liechtenstein, followed by up to five digits as the registration number.
LI.alphabet: Latin, no notable restrictions on which letters are used.
LI.vanity_plates: Personalized/vanity plates are available for CHF 500, but only through online auctions.

LT.format_explanation: Three letters followed by three numbers, with no space between them.
LT.alphabet: Latin; letters Q, W, and X are not used.
LT.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
LT.strip_contents: EU flag and country code LT

LU.format_explanation: Two letters followed by four digits.
LU.alphabet: Latin; Letters I and O are excluded.
LU.forbidden_combinations: AA, CD, HJ, KK, KZ, PD, SA, SS, WC, ZZ
LU.vanity_plates: Personalized/vanity plates are available at a cost of €200, but must conform to the standard format or consist of four or five digits.
LU.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
LU.strip_contents: EU flag and country code L

LV.format_explanation: Two letters followed by a hyphen and one to four numbers, where the letters represent a region or a designation code and the numbers are the unique serial number.
LV.alphabet: Latin, with restrictions on certain letters such as O and Q to avoid confusion with numbers.
LV.vanity_plates: Personalized plates are available, consisting of two to eight symbols with a cost increase to 2,500 LVL since 2006.
LV.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
LV.strip_contents: EU flag and country code LV

MD.format_explanation: Three letters representing the series followed by three numbers as the serial number.
MD.colors_strip: Blue euroband with the Moldovan flag
MD.strip_contents: Moldovan flag and country code MD

ME.format_explanation: AA is the municipality code, ∇ represents the coat of arms, AA is a two-letter series, and 000 is a three-digit serial number.
ME.alphabet: Latin alphabet; letters I and O are omitted from serial combinations to avoid confusion with the numbers 1 and 0. Other omitted letters include W, X, Y, Q, and special characters (Č,Ć,Š,Đ,Ž).
ME.vanity_plates: Yes, customized plates with any letter-number combination are available.

MK.format_explanation: The first two letters are the region code, followed by a 4-digit serial number, and a 2-letter alpha code.
MK.alphabet: Latin alphabet with Cyrillic equivalents; the letters Q, W, X, and Y are not used.
MK.vanity_plates: Personalized/vanity plates are available, details not mentioned.

NL.format_explanation: The pattern consists of letters and digits, where A represents letters and 0 represents numbers. The series may vary but typically follows a structure of letters and numbers in two parts.
NL.alphabet: Latin alphabet, with notable restrictions on vowels (A, E, I, O, U) to avoid profane language, and C and Q omitted to prevent confusion with zero. Letters M and W are not used due to their width.
NL.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
NL.strip_contents: EU flag and country code NL

NO.format_explanation: Two letters represent the geographic registration area followed by a serial number of four or five digits.
NO.alphabet: Latin; the letters G, I, O, and Q are not used due to similarity with other characters.
NO.forbidden_combinations: The combinations 'NS' and 'SS' are prohibited due to associations with WWII; additionally, the Norwegian letters Æ, Ø, and Å are not used.
NO.vanity_plates: Personalized plates are available with combinations of two to seven letters and digits, subject to rules against offensive words and trademarks, for a fee of NOK 9,000.
NO.colors_strip: Blue nationality stripe with the Norwegian flag
NO.strip_contents: National flag and international vehicle registration code 'N'

PL.format_explanation: AA represents the county code with the first letter indicating the voivodeship, followed by a series of numbers and letters that specify the vehicle's registration uniquely.
PL.alphabet: Latin alphabet, excluding the letter Q. Some letters like B, D, I, O, and Z are restricted in certain serial areas due to potential confusion with digits.
PL.forbidden_combinations: B, D, I, O, and Z cannot be used in the series area to avoid confusion with digits. Custom plates may include these letters.
PL.vanity_plates: Custom plates are available with specific rules regarding letter and number combinations. Each custom number starts with the voivodeship letter and a single digit, followed by 3 to 5 characters.
PL.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
PL.strip_contents: EU flag and country code PL

PT.format_explanation: Two letters, followed by two numbers, followed by two letters. The letters do not correspond to any geographical location.

RO.format_explanation: AA is a two-letter county code, 00 is a two or three-digit group, and AAA is a three-letter group.
RO.alphabet: Latin, with the letter Q not used and three-letter codes restricted from starting with I or O.
RO.forbidden_combinations: Q is not used to avoid confusion with O. Codes may not start with I or O; combinations like III or OOO are banned. Combinations forming obscene words are denied licensing but may still be in use if issued before the ban.
RO.vanity_plates: Yes, customization is permitted for the last three letters, provided they are not already assigned.
RO.colors_strip: Blue vertical strip displaying the EU stars and the country code RO
RO.typeface: DIN 1451 Mittelschrift for the plate, DIN 1451 Engschrift for country code on the Euroband.
RO.strip_contents: EU flag and country code RO

RS.format_explanation: Two-letter regional code followed by three or four-digit numeric code, and then a two-letter alpha code.
RS.alphabet: Latin alphabet (Serbian Latin) with the addition of letter X; letters Ć, Č, Š, Ž, Đ, Y, and W are restricted.
RS.forbidden_combinations: Plates with the special 'hooked' letters of the Serbian Latin alphabet (Ć, Č, Š, Ž, Đ) and letters Y and W are no longer issued.
RS.colors_strip: Blue field placed along the left side edge bearing 'SRB'

SE.format_explanation: Three letters followed by three characters: either three digits (AAA 000) or two digits and a letter (AAA 00A). The last character indicates the month for vehicle tax payment.
SE.alphabet: Latin; letters I, Q, V, Å, Ä, Ö, and O are excluded in specific contexts.
SE.forbidden_combinations: Over 90 combinations deemed offensive, political, or otherwise unsuitable. Examples include APA, ARG, DUM, FAN, GAY, HOT, SEX, and others.
SE.vanity_plates: Personalized plates allowed with rules; cost is 6900 kr (about 570 €), valid for ten years.
SE.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
SE.strip_contents: EU flag and country code S

SI.format_explanation: The first two letters denote the region where the car was registered, followed by a four-digit serial number, and ending with two letters that may represent administrative or regional identifiers.
SI.alphabet: Latin; letters such as C, D, I, O, Q, and Z are excluded.
SI.vanity_plates: Personalized/vanity plates are available, with unspecified rules or costs.
SI.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars
SI.strip_contents: EU flag and country code SLO

SK.format_explanation: AA is a two-letter district code, ∇ represents the Slovak coat of arms, 000 is a three-digit serial number, and AA is a two-letter series code.
SK.alphabet: Latin, excluding letters Q and W as well as Slovak letters such as Š.
SK.vanity_plates: Personalized plates are available for an extra fee, but must include the random letters and five other characters, with restrictions on political, religious, or offensive messages.
SK.colors_strip: Blue EU band with yellow stars

TR.format_explanation: 00 represents two digits for the province code, AA represents one or two letters, and 0000 represents four digits.
TR.alphabet: Turkish alphabet (excluding Ç, Ş, İ, Ö, Ü, Ğ, and Latin letters Q, W, X)
TR.vanity_plates: Personalized plates are available; a desired text can replace the serial letter place.
TR.colors_strip: Blue stripe on the left side
TR.strip_contents: Country code 'TR' in the blue stripe

UA.format_explanation: AA represents a two-letter regional code, 0000 represents four digits of the serial number, and AA at the end is a two-letter suffix.
UA.alphabet: Cyrillic with specific Latin resembling glyphs (А, В, Е, І, К, М, Н, О, Р, С, Т, Х).
UA.forbidden_combinations: BP (can be read as Верховна Рада, Ukraine's parliament) and CC (can be read as SS, Schutzstaffel).
UA.vanity_plates: Personalized/vanity plates are available, recognized as cherished for specific combinations and cost between ₴7,500 to ₴20,000.
UA.colors_strip: National-flag-colored band on the left edge
UA.strip_contents: UA and the nation's coat of arms

XK.format_explanation: 00 is the regional code, 000 is a three-digit number starting from 101, and AA are two serial letters.
XK.alphabet: Latin alphabet with letters A to Q
XK.colors_strip: Blue field with gold colour for RKS
